Installation of SwSpotify¶

This part of the documentation covers the installation of SwagLyrics for Spotify. The first step to using any software package is getting it properly installed.

$ pip install SwSpotify¶

To install SwagLyrics, simply run this simple command in your terminal of choice:

$ pip install SwSpotify

SwagLyrics requires Python 3.6+. Use pip or pip3 depending on your installation.

Cool kids these days recommend doing :bash:`python -m pip install SwSpotify`, but either work.

Living on the edge¶

SwSpotify is developed on GitHub, where the code is always available. It contains the latest code before it is released but should hopefully always work.

You can clone the public repository:

$ git clone git://SwagLyrics/SwSpotify.git

Once you have a copy of the source, you can embed it in your own Python package, or install it into your site-packages easily:

$ cd SwSpotify
$ pip install .
